title: It often feels that Riot just wants to rotate what's strong rather than actually balance.
body:
After SQ was taken away, despite [many problems highlighted with DQ before it was even introduced](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/b0VZUOVk-the-real-problem-with-dynamic-ques-isnt-matchmaking-imbalance), I've lost the motivation to make detailed posts.

I will say however that I recently watched a Riot Playtest on Twitch and one of the responses from the playtesters stated that they want to keep things fresh. It makes sense that every champion should have an equal chance to succeed for whatever niche they have but I kind of get the feeling that Riot deliberately overbuffs and overnerfs to just change the meta dramatically. 

It doesn't seem like they are actually trying to balance the game as much as just rotating through the champions for what's strong. In other words, it feels more like their balance philosophy is about showcasing a group of champions for a month or two and then either overbuffing or overnerfing to switch to a new group.
